intro: Boehmeria lindeniana, commonly known as the Indian nettle or Chinese nettle, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Boehmeria lindeniana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. It has been used traditionally in some regions for its medicinal properties.
